newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOTOR RACING-DINIZ JOINS HILL AT ARROWS.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-DINIZ JOINS HILL AT ARROWS.

text.p: Brazilian Pedro Diniz will partner Damon Hill in the TWR Arrows Formula One team next season.
Diniz, with Ligier this season, is believed to be taking a sponsorship package worth around $8 million to his new team -- more than enough to cover Hill's wages.

The Brazilian said on Friday: "Tom (Walkinshaw, team owner), TWR and myself enjoyed a very positive relationship during our time together at Ligier, so I know from experience that they are people that I can achieve things with.
"I have enormous respect for the way that Tom goes racing and the all-round strength of the package he has put together for 1997 made the decision very easy for me."
Walkinshaw said: "I am pleased that Pedro has chosen to join us. He has surprised many people this year with his pace and consistency and is certainly the most improved driver of the season."
